Name: Money
Description: for financial compensation, with the amount depending on risk and desperation.

Name: Ideology
Description: for advancement with a cause they believe in, or against a cause they despise.

Name: Coercion
Description: by aggressive or violent means - typically physical/emotional bullying or blackmail.

Name: Ego
Description: to inflate or validate their ego - either by undermining opponents or by highlighting their success.

Name: Versatile
Description: is both a rational and intuitive person.

Name: Analytical
Description: is a rational person, but not very intuitive.

Name: Indifferent
Description: is neither a very rational person, nor very intuitive.

Name: Intuitive
Description: is a intuitive person, but not very rational.

Name: Rational Ability
Description: information collecting skills.

Name: Rational Engagement
Description: action taking skills

Name: Experiential Ability
Description: interpersonal communication skills

Name: Experiential Engagement
Description: information analysis skills

Name: Openness
Description: A person's willingness to try new things and think outside the box. These people are curious, creative, and imaginative.

Name: Conscientiousness
Description: A person's level of organization, thoughtfulness, and goal-orientation. These people are more disciplined and persistent.

Name: Extroversion
Description: A person's level of sociability, assertiveness, and energy. These people are more likely to be talkative, outgoing, and have a wide social circle.

Name: Agreeableness
Description: A person's level of kindness, altruism, and trust. These people are more cooperative and prosocial.

Name: Neuroticism
Description: A person's tendency to experience negative emotions like anxiety, guilt, anger, and depression. These people are more likely to experience these feelings.

Name: Thinking
Description: Enneagram thinking centers

Name: Feeling
Description: Enneagram feeling centers

Name: Instinctive
Description: Enneagram instinctive centers
